AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The AI-CS Integration messages are largely standard case-creation/auto-reminder templates. There is no customer-facing statement that the AI was wrong/misleading, and no clearly incorrect AI guidance is shown being corrected in-thread.
evidence: “Based on your recent request we have created the case 00447584.”
“An automated reminder was sent on 28 May 2025 to all recipients of the case.”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer is not stuck interacting only with AI; multiple human agents respond and request details. There is no request for a human followed by continued AI-only responses.
evidence: “Hi Bharath, Thank you for reaching Khoros support… We are looking into this…”
“Hello Subramani, My name is Huzaif, and I will be assisting you with this case moving forward.”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support asks for information that the requester indicates was already provided in earlier emails/screenshots (and repeats the 'when did this start' question after being told it never worked). This forces the requester to re-point support back to already-shared context.
evidence: Support: “Can you please tell when the customer started facing this issue? Also, could be please share the steps to reproduce and a screen recording of the issue…”
Customer: “This has never worked for the customer.”
Customer: “In my previous email, I've attached the necessary screenshots showing the error… Please let me know if you need any details.”
Support (later): “When did this issue first occur? Was it when Marcus's account was created in Care?”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The visible staff responses generally occur within 0–2 days after customer-facing updates, and longer gaps appear driven by waiting for customer-provided items (e.g., test account/logs) rather than silence after a customer message.
evidence: Customer: “Hi Huzaif,… I'll keep you posted. Please keep this case open.” (2025-06-10T16:59:20+00:00)
Support: “Thank you for the update. We are currently reviewing it…” (2025-06-11T16:37:59+00:00)

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The case was closed/marked resolved via automation while the customer indicated the issue was not resolved and the investigation was still pending requested items (test account/logs). The customer explicitly requested reopening and later asked to keep it open while preparing logs.
evidence: Support: “This case has now been closed.” (2025-06-10T09:02:20+00:00)
Customer: “Please reopen this case. The issue is yet to be resolved.” (2025-06-10T12:46:38+00:00)
Automation: “Based on previous information received, your case has been marked as resolved.” (2025-06-24T17:30:11+00:00)
Customer: “Please keep this ticket open for now. I'll share the logs as soon as possible.” (2025-06-25T10:31:00+00:00)

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: While the requester asked to prioritize, there is no explicit P1/SEV1/critical/outage language or clear multi-user production-down impact described that would require incident-style handling based on the ticket text.
evidence: “I'd appreciate it if you could prioritize this.”
“Marcus (Mark) Brewer… cannot access the Community Analytics in Care Analytics.”
